header.title: Esoteric Extension of Tarot to Develop Supersensory Powers

central_thesis: The lesson posits that Tarot Key 8, 'Strength,' symbolizes the mastery and channeling of the Kundalini, or serpent energy, through the humanization of the animal soul consciousness. This mastery is achieved not through forceful methods but through a gradual, balanced awakening facilitated by esoteric disciplines aligned with Western traditions, ultimately leading to the development of supersensory powers.

structure_content.chapter_title: LESSON 26: Transcriptions from Ann Davies' Class Lectures
structure_content.summary: This lesson focuses on Tarot Key 8 (Strength) as representing the initial stage of developing supersensory powers by understanding the 'secret of all spiritual activities'—the lion as a symbol of evolution and the vital/animal soul. It introduces the Hebrew letter Teth and the number 8 as symbols of perfection and continuous motion, linking them to the Kundalini energy coiled at the base of the spine. The text warns against dangerous, forceful methods of awakening Kundalini, advocating for controlled, supervised practices within a suitable cultural environment, as taught by the Western school of occultism, B.O.T.A., which draws from Essene and Eleusinian traditions to evolve the animal nature and subconsciousness towards humanization.

key_concepts.definition: The serpent energy, said to lie coiled at the base of the spine, associated with the vital or animal soul consciousness. Awakening this energy is crucial for developing supersensory powers, but forceful methods can lead to insanity; a gradual, controlled awakening is emphasized.

The primordial, untamed part of human awareness shared with creatures below the human evolutionary stage, symbolized by the lion in Tarot Key 8. Humanizing this consciousness is central to occult development and the safe awakening of Kundalini.

The process of transforming the raw, wild, primordial energy of the animal soul into a controlled, cultivated aspect of consciousness. This is achieved through discipline, directed desire (symbolized by roses), and self-conscious attention, leading to higher states of awareness.

Symbolizes the process of awakening Kundalini by depicting a woman (representing human consciousness) controlling a lion (representing the animal soul). The image conveys that this energy is tamed and directed by cultivated desire and love, aligning with the Magician's principle of self-conscious attention.

The principle by which self-consciousness evolves. By limiting the scope of attention and activity (e.g., focusing on reading a book), consciousness is concentrated, allowing for the development of higher states. This disciplined control is what distinguishes humans and allows them to shape primordial matter.

The Western school of occultism represented in the text, which teaches esoteric traditions derived from the Essenes and Eleusinian Mysteries, specifically aimed at the evolution and humanization of Western man's subconsciousness.

practical_system.description: The text outlines a practical system for developing supersensory powers centered on the controlled awakening and integration of the Kundalini energy. This is achieved through understanding and applying the symbolism of Tarot Key 8, which teaches the mastery of the 'animal soul' (lion) through cultivated desire and love (roses). The core principle is 'humanization'—gaining conscious control over primal energies through 'limitation' and discipline, rather than forceful suppression or chaotic release. This disciplined approach, guided by esoteric teachings and symbolic representation, aims for a gradual, balanced evolution of consciousness, fostering higher perceptiveness, control, and awareness.
tools: Symbolism of the number 8 and the coiled serpent
Symbolism of roses (representing cultivated desire and love)
rituals: Meditation on Tarot Key 8, particularly focusing on the symbolism of the woman, the lion, and the roses.
Breathing exercises and Yoga (mentioned as acceptable methods, implying structured practice).
Chanting of certain mantras (mentioned as acceptable methods, implying structured practice).

A weekly practice of 'weaving chains of roses around your emotional and desire nature' by mentally encircling negative impulses (irritation, anger, hostility, envy) with symbolic roses, to tame the 'lion' of primal desire and lift the human aspect of consciousness.

relevant_quotes.text: In both the Eastern and the Western traditions, the final aim of occult disciplines is to awaken the Kundalini's energy flow.

If they are able to force the awakening of the Kundalini prematurely, the result is usually insanity. The Kundalini is the energy of the vital soul, the animal consciousness. If the human consciousness loses or relinquishes control of this energy, it becomes controlled by its own lower forces which is what happens in violent types of insanity.
The symbolism of both the 8 and of the serpent's tail points to the very special activity of the Kundalini, the serpent energy, said to lie coiled at the base of the spine.

Every last detail of each Tarot key gives messages to your subconsciousness, whether or not you are consciously aware of the meaning; the subconscious receives positive suggestions bringing higher perceptiveness, greater control, and greater awareness.

Here red roses of desire form the figure 8, connecting the higher aspects of subconsciousness with the lion. Since roses are cultivated flowers, you are told through this image that subconsciousness should respond and act from cultivated desire rather than from animal desire.

The lion itself also indicates the Mars energy by its red color. Mars energy is very closely related to reproductive energy on all levels: plant, animal, human. It is one energy that expresses itself on many different levels, the energy by which we grow and work.

All control, all supersensory powers, all applications of power depend on our thorough understanding of the principles portrayed by this key and our ability to align ourselves with its activities and laws. That is why Key 8 is called the secret of all spiritual activity.
Self-consciousness is evolved by limiting the area of consciousness. What is limitation but an inhibiting of our scope of activity?

For this week, try using the discipline of weaving chains of roses around your emotional and desire nature. Every time you find yourself getting irritated, angry, hostile or envious, mentally throw a loop of roses around that particular lion. Lift your heart to the loving human aspect of your subconsciousness and learn to pet your animal nature into becoming a willing servant, serving your evolution as you grow ever closer to the Most High.

critical_analysis.relevance: This lesson is highly relevant to practitioners of Western Esotericism interested in the practical application of Tarot beyond divination, specifically for the development of latent psychic and spiritual abilities. It places the Tarot within a Qabalistic framework and connects it to the vital energies central to many occult systems, like Kundalini yoga, but reframes its awakening through a Western magical lens focused on disciplined consciousness and humanization of primal energies.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience includes students and practitioners of esoteric traditions, particularly those within or aligned with the B.O.T.A. system, who are seeking to understand and develop supersensory powers. It is aimed at individuals with some existing foundation in occult concepts who are looking for structured, psychologically grounded methods to achieve spiritual and psychic evolution, with a strong emphasis on controlled self-mastery.
